result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathaniel B Aldrich

records.addlTxt: All records scanned

Defendant Nathaniel B Aldrich in court with attorney John Anthony Ward.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Robin Anderson
In addition to the testimony of both doctors, the Court has reviewed numerous reports.

BTC: Based on all information the Court has received and reviewed, the Court does not believe the defendant is competent to proceed in this matter.  DHS or the State is to make the determination as to how we need to proceed. 

Defense asks the Court to suspend proceedings and if deft's competency is restored, proceedings can be reinstated. The State indicates that this is the type of case that Corp Counsel will recommend for a Ch. 51. The State has nothing else to proceed forward with at this time. Defense indicates that def'ts parents are in the process of gaining guardianship.

BTC: Proceedings are suspended. If deft regains competency, proceedings may be reinstated. Deft is released from conditions of bond.

#1-report of Dr. Thompson
#2-CV of Dr. Thompson

Letter to Defendant RE: Bond Monitoring
Review hearing on September 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   ***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions meeting with atty and going to court. May go to work must advise employer of criminal charges.  No contact with any Parks. No contact with Bike Path. No contact with VLF.     You have been ordered to have to provide a DNA sample as a condition of your bond.  Report to the Sheriff's Office Records Bureau. Hours:  Monday through Friday between 9:00 a.m. and 11:30 a.m. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED GPS Monitor to be removed. Must comply with his parents rules at home.**

Defendant Nathaniel B Aldrich in court with attorney John Anthony Ward.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
Def- Not objecting to the doctor's report.
BTC: Adjourn for another 90 days. Proceedings are suspended.
Def- Request the court modify the bond to remove the GPS monitor.
St- Objects to removing the GPS monitor.
BTC: Bond modification granted. GPS monitor to be removed, must comply with his parents rules at home and all other conditions to remain in place.  Review hearing scheduled for September 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
